mods.abstract: Pre-Columbian solid figure with large adorned headdress and ear adornments. Clove shaped breasts just above an exagerated navel. Possibly a fertility figure. Adornment on the chin starting at the lip and going down. Left arm is slightly longer than the right arm. Large rounded protrusion that flattens and runs down the back side of the figurine.

Breakage below the exagerated navel suggests this figure might have been representative of a full body at one point. Both arms have been broken off and reglued. some chipping around the edges but overall the features are clear and the piece is in good condition.

titleInfo.title: Pre-Columbian figurines
Pre-Columbian cultural artifacts
George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
